## Description {#details}

This file defines the SparseSet class derived from the version described in Briggs, Torczon, &quot;An efficient representation for sparse sets&quot;, ACM Letters on Programming Languages and Systems, Volume 2 Issue 1-4, March-Dec.

1993

A sparse set holds a small number of objects identified by integer keys from a moderately sized universe. The sparse set uses more memory than other containers in order to provide faster operations.

<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// SparseSetValTraits - Objects in a SparseSet are identified by keys that can</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// be uniquely converted to a small integer less than the set&#39;s universe. This</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// class allows the set to hold values that differ from the set&#39;s key type as</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// long as an index can still be derived from the value. SparseSet never</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// directly compares ValueT, only their indices, so it can map keys to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// arbitrary values. SparseSetValTraits computes the index from the value</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// object. To compute the index from a key, SparseSet uses a separate</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// KeyFunctorT template argument.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// A simple type declaration, SparseSet&lt;Type&gt;, handles these cases:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// - unsigned key, identity index, identity value</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// - unsigned key, identity index, fat value providing getSparseSetIndex()</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The type declaration SparseSet&lt;Type, UnaryFunction&gt; handles:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// - unsigned key, remapped index, identity value (virtual registers)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// - pointer key, pointer-derived index, identity value (node+ID)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// - pointer key, pointer-derived index, fat value with getSparseSetIndex()</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Only other, unexpected cases require specializing SparseSetValTraits.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> KeyFunctorT()(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a98c6256d0644613c6b5b3e2ef06ef5ce">Key</a>);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// SparseSet - Fast set implementation for objects that can be identified by</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// small unsigned keys.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// SparseSet allocates memory proportional to the size of the key universe, so</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// it is not recommended for building composite data structures.  It is useful</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// for algorithms that require a single set with fast operations.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Compared to DenseSet and DenseMap, SparseSet provides constant-time fast</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// clear() and iteration as fast as a vector.  The find(), insert(), and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// erase() operations are all constant time, and typically faster than a hash</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// table.  The iteration order doesn&#39;t depend on numerical key values, it only</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// depends on the order of insert() and erase() operations.  When no elements</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// have been erased, the iteration order is the insertion order.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Compared to BitVector, SparseSet&lt;unsigned&gt; uses 8x-40x more memory, but</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// offers constant-time clear() and size() operations as well as fast</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// iteration independent on the size of the universe.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// SparseSet contains a dense vector holding all the objects and a sparse</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// array holding indexes into the dense vector.  Most of the memory is used by</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the sparse array which is the size of the key universe.  The SparseT</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// template parameter provides a space/speed tradeoff for sets holding many</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// elements.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// When SparseT is uint32&#95;t, find() only touches 2 cache lines, but the sparse</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// array uses 4 x Universe bytes.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// When SparseT is uint8&#95;t (the default), find() touches up to 2+&#91;N/256&#93; cache</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// lines, but the sparse array is 4x smaller.  N is the number of elements in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the set.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// For sets that may grow to thousands of elements, SparseT should be set to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// uint16&#95;t or uint32&#95;t.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// @tparam ValueT      The type of objects in the set.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// @tparam KeyFunctorT A functor that computes an unsigned index from KeyT.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// @tparam SparseT     An unsigned integer type. See above.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">template</span><span class="doxyHighlight">&lt;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">typename</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ValueT,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><span class="doxyHighlight">         </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">typename</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> KeyFunctorT = identity&lt;unsigned&gt;,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><span class="doxyHighlight">         </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">typename</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> SparseT = uint8&#95;t&gt;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// setUniverse - Set the universe size which determines the largest key the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// set can hold.  The universe must be sized before any elements can be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// added.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// @param U Universe size. All object keys must be less than U.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sparseset/#ac5c4065b01268eb6764867041cd1d96c"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sparseset/#ac5c4065b01268eb6764867041cd1d96c">setUniverse</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> U) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// It&#39;s not hard to resize the universe on a non-empty set, but it doesn&#39;t</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="162"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// seem like a likely use case, so we can add that code when we need it.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="163"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sparseset/#aa4dfc2338a3ed82eb01661c5391339d6">empty</a>() &amp;&amp; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;Can only resize universe on an empty map&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="164"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Hysteresis prevents needless reallocations.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="165"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (U &gt;= Universe/4 &amp;&amp; U &lt;= Universe)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="166"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="167"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The Sparse array doesn&#39;t actually need to be initialized, so malloc</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="168"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// would be enough here, but that will cause tools like valgrind to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="169"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// complain about branching on uninitialized data.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="170"><span class="doxyHighlight">    Sparse.reset(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static&#95;cast&lt;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">SparseT &#42;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">&gt;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a53b2f25342c49b78f06fbec9cf7fe644">safe&#95;calloc</a>(U, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">sizeof</span><span class="doxyHighlight">(SparseT))));</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00171" /><CodeLine lineNumber="171"><span class="doxyHighlight">    Universe = U;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="172"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="173"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="174"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Import trivial vector stuff from DenseT.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00189" /><CodeLine lineNumber="189"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// size - Returns the number of elements in the set.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00190" /><CodeLine lineNumber="190"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00191" /><CodeLine lineNumber="191"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// This is not the same as BitVector::size() which returns the size of the</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00193" /><CodeLine lineNumber="193"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00194" /><CodeLine lineNumber="194" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sparseset/#a02a393a8e880f597847b25bf64c19020"><span class="doxyHighlight">  size&#95;type <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sparseset/#a02a393a8e880f597847b25bf64c19020">size</a>()</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Dense.size(); &#125;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00196" /><CodeLine lineNumber="196"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// clear - Clears the set.  This is a very fast constant time operation.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="197"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="198" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sparseset/#aab146f4c3793a4a99649ce52b3badc15"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sparseset/#aab146f4c3793a4a99649ce52b3badc15">clear</a>() &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="200"><span class="doxyHighlight">    Dense.clear();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="201"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="202"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="203"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// findIndex - Find an element by its index.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="204"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="205"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// @param   Idx A valid index to find.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="206"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// @returns An iterator to the element identified by key, or end().</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="207"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="208" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sparseset/#a037d6235d5fcccb54010dd1aec2572ff"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sparseset/#a9dd9e59619f2ce3f425abb29690ff88d">iterator</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sparseset/#a037d6235d5fcccb54010dd1aec2572ff">findIndex</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Idx) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="209"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(Idx &lt; Universe &amp;&amp; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;Key out of range&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="210"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(Sparse != </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &amp;&amp; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;Invalid sparse type&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="211"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Stride = std::numeric&#95;limits&lt;SparseT&gt;::max() + 1u;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="212"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">for</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> i = Sparse&#91;Idx&#93;, e = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/nvptx/nvvmreflect-cpp/#ac934769d93af95250952646a3829df4c">size</a>(); i &lt; e; i += Stride) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="213"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> FoundIdx = ValIndexOf(Dense&#91;i&#93;);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="214"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(FoundIdx &lt; Universe &amp;&amp; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;Invalid key in set. Did object mutate?&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="215"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (Idx == FoundIdx)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="216"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sparseset/#aba206b8828cec695dbe9fadfe2cddbfa">begin</a>() + i;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="217"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Stride is 0 when SparseT &gt;= unsigned.  We don&#39;t need to loop.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="218"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (!Stride)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="219"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">break</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00279" /><CodeLine lineNumber="279"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// erase - Erases an existing element identified by a valid iterator.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00280" /><CodeLine lineNumber="280"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00281" /><CodeLine lineNumber="281"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// This invalidates all iterators, but erase() returns an iterator pointing</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00282" /><CodeLine lineNumber="282"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// to the next element.  This makes it possible to erase selected elements</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00283" /><CodeLine lineNumber="283"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// while iterating over the set:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00284" /><CodeLine lineNumber="284"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00285" /><CodeLine lineNumber="285"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   for (SparseSet::iterator I = Set.begin(); I != Set.end();)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00286" /><CodeLine lineNumber="286"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///     if (test(&#42;I))</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00287" /><CodeLine lineNumber="287"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///       I = Set.erase(I);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00288" /><CodeLine lineNumber="288"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///     else</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00289" /><CodeLine lineNumber="289"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///       ++I;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00290" /><CodeLine lineNumber="290"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00291" /><CodeLine lineNumber="291"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Note that end() changes when elements are erased, unlike std::list.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00292" /><CodeLine lineNumber="292"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
